page.title: 04Darland School, Rossett
page.content:
At present there are approximately 50 teachers and 1000 pupils at Darland School. The current headmaster is D.J.Gwilliam who came to the school in 1978.
There have been plans to further extend the school including another hall and a swimming pool but education cuts have meant that only mobile classrooms have been added. Mobiles are now to be removed as pupil numbers decrease. Two classrooms are in the process of conversion into an electronics laboratory.
In 1984 the school bought a minibus with the assistance of the Parent Teacher Association. They have also helped to buy camping equipment and microcomputers.
